snippet: A task force has relocated more than 200 people from the overcrowded, unregulated dwellings, but the city still faces many challenges in resolving the problem.
abstract: New York City task force charged with investigating overcrowded conditions in unregulated dwellings known as three-quarter homes has moved upwards of 200 people, many of whom are in drug rehabilitation, mentally ill or homeless, from squalid housing into hotels; move is temporary, and many of those who remain in three-quarter homes say they continue to be overcrowded and that conditions are deplorable, highlighting scale of challenge city faces.
lead_paragraph: A task force has relocated more than 200 people from the overcrowded, unregulated dwellings, but the city still faces many challenges in resolving the problem.

headline.main: New York City Starts Moving Tenants From ‘Three-Quarter’ Homes, but Others Are Left Behind
headline.print_headline: Tenants Move Out of Unregulated Homes, but Remain in Limbo
